intro: Punctillaria dekenahii, commonly known as the Deken's starwort, is a rare aquatic plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and marshes. Its botanical features include filamentous roots and a branched stem that supports its leaf structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
